div.p: Marcus Aurelius Sarapion, son of Mikkalos, and however I am styled, to Marcus Aurelius Horion, veteran honourably discharged, greetings. I acknowledge that I have received from you your ammokopregon river boat, with Myrismos as its ensign, with mast, and yard, and sails made (padded?) with rush-mats … with four punt poles with iron heads … and two other punt poles?, and with a rope … and anchor cables?, with bilge boards, so that I perform with it the ammokopregike work, with sufficient crew, for twelve months from the tenth of the present month. And of all produced fertiliser, I shall pay you the share of one third, blamelessly and in exemplary fashion. And I shall pay…
Receipt of Myrismos Translation: E. Chepel, APF 69 (2023) 114
